creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description: famille rose; European subjects; probably replacements for a Sevres or Worcester service; central bouquet within gilt border, floral and blue-ground panels below shaped rims
medium: Porcelain with enamel and gilded decoration
text: This dish formed part of a dessert service similar to those made in a number of English factories, with shaped dishes and baskets raised on pedestals. The original of this pattern was almost certainly Coalport porcelain of about 1805, and the Chinese version would have been ordered as part of service in competition with English ware.
title: Cushion-shaped dish
